conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph to determine acceleration direction during 0 to 10 seconds.
Graph shows vertical velocity of skydiver over time.
Skydiver starts at a velocity of 20 m/s.
Velocity increases linearly from 0 to 10 seconds indicating constant acceleration.
Calculate acceleration as slope of line: (20 m/s - 0 m/s) / 10 s = 2 m/s².
Acceleration is positive (2 m/s²), so direction is upward.
Direction of acceleration during 0 to 10 seconds is upward.
